TEXT: The applicant , PERSON , is a NORP national , who was born in DATE and lives in GPE , GPE . The respondent Government were represented by Mr PERSON , from ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
In DATE the applicant was diagnosed with amyotrophic lateral sclerosis ( ORG ) also known as PERSON disease .
In DATE the applicant was prescribed PERSON , a drug used to treat ORG .
On DATE the applicant asked ORG ( ORG ) to refund him the cost of the drug . He pointed out that he was a pensioner and that the price of a prescribed DATE intake of the drug exceeded his means .
In a letter of DATE the ORG declined the applicant ’s request in the following terms :

“ In reply to your letter ( ... ) I should explain that ORG does not have legal possibilities of refunding the price you paid for drugs . ORG publishes registers of drugs which are refunded and according to those registers the ORG Funds make either partial or full refunds . In your case , CARDINAL out of CARDINAL drugs are fully refunded . As for ORG , it is included in the register of refunded drugs ( patient ’s contribution at PERCENT ) [ ... ] . ORG pays PERCENT of the price of [ that drug ] .
I should also inform you that you can be assisted by [ ... ] ORG ( ... ) . ”

On DATE the applicant asked PERSON ( ORG ) to quash the decision of the ORG . He submitted that he could not afford to pay for the drug and that he had no children to help him . ORG transmitted the applicant ’s request to ORG .
On DATE the Director of ORG ( ORG Społecznej ) issued a decision declining the applicant ’s application for the drug refund .
In a letter of CARDINAL DATE ORG ( PERSON ) informed the applicant that :

“ ( ... ) According to the applicable legislation the Director [ of ORG ] issued a decision declining your request for assistance . It appears from your file that the total income of your family amounts to ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL.CARDINAL and is above the threshold set in Article CARDINAL ) of ORG . Despite the fact that you have faced high costs for the purchase of drugs , the social services – because of limited resources designated for that purpose – declined your request ( ... ) .
It should also be mentioned that it is possible to approach a certified doctor – through ORG – in order to change a degree of invalidity , which may result in the grant of a nursing benefit . ”
On DATE ORG advised the applicant about the legislation concerning the refund of drugs . The ORG ’s letter was in the following terms :
“ ORG correctly informed you in a letter of PERSON ] that there were no legal possibilities of refunding the expenses you incurred for purchasing drugs .

ORG is listed in the register of drugs used in chronic illnesses ( ... ) for a payment of PERCENT [ of the price ] . That drug is refunded at the rate of PERCENT and ORG pays such a part of the price . ...

As PERSON continues to be a very heavy financial burden for patients , ORG has started to make efforts to decrease the rate at which it has to be paid for by patients , so that it becomes available free of charge . The matter has been transferred to specialists ...

The end of this work concerning the change of registers is foreseen for DATE . However , any decrease in the rate at which [ the drug ] has to be paid for by patients depends on the financial resources available to ORG . ”
On DATE the applicant ’s degree of invalidity was increased from the second to the first degree .
The applicant lodged with ORG ( Sąd Najwyższy ) a complaint concerning the decision of ORG but on DATE the court informed him that no appeal was available against the ORG ’s decision .

The public health service in GPE is regulated by ORG of DATE . ORG Funds , which represent the interests of the insured , buy medical services from contractors . They also refund the cost of drugs in whole or in part .
